data_exploration.description: Explore the structure and properties of a dataset
data_exploration.task: Use str(), names(), dim(), and summary() to explore the dataset structure

descriptive_stats_basic.title: Basic Descriptive Statistics
descriptive_stats_basic.description: Calculate central tendency measures for numeric variables
descriptive_stats_basic.task: Calculate the mean, median, and mode for the 'score' variable, handling missing values
descriptive_stats_basic.reference_solution:
mean(students$score, na.rm = TRUE)
median(students$score, na.rm = TRUE)
# Mode calculation
table(students$score) |> which.max() |> names()

descriptive_stats_spread.title: Measures of Variability
descriptive_stats_spread.description: Calculate dispersion measures to understand data spread
descriptive_stats_spread.task: Calculate range, variance, standard deviation, and quartiles for the 'score' variable
descriptive_stats_spread.reference_solution:
range(students$score, na.rm = TRUE)
var(students$score, na.rm = TRUE)
sd(students$score, na.rm = TRUE)
quantile(students$score, na.rm = TRUE)

histogram_basic.title: Create a Histogram
histogram_basic.description: Visualize the distribution of a continuous variable using histogram
histogram_basic.task: Create a histogram of student scores with proper titles and labels
histogram_basic.reference_solution:
hist(students$score,
     main = 'Distribution of Student Scores',
     xlab = 'Score',
     ylab = 'Frequency',
     col = 'skyblue',
     breaks = 10)

boxplot_comparison.title: Boxplot for Group Comparison
boxplot_comparison.description: Compare distributions across groups using boxplots
boxplot_comparison.task: Create a boxplot comparing scores by student major
boxplot_comparison.reference_solution:
boxplot(score ~ major, 
        data = students,
        main = 'Scores by Major',
        xlab = 'Major',
        ylab = 'Score',
        col = c('lightblue', 'lightgreen', 'lightcoral'))

pipe_filtering.title: Data Filtering with Pipes
pipe_filtering.description: Use pipe operators for readable data filtering operations
pipe_filtering.task: Filter students with scores > 80 and select name, major, and score columns using pipes
pipe_filtering.reference_solution:
library(dplyr)
students |>
  filter(score > 80) |>
  select(name, major, score)

pipe_summarizing.title: Data Summarization with Pipes
pipe_summarizing.description: Create summary statistics by groups using pipe operations
pipe_summarizing.task: Group by major and calculate mean and median scores for each group
pipe_summarizing.reference_solution:
students |>
  group_by(major) |>
  summarise(
    mean_score = mean(score, na.rm = TRUE),
    median_score = median(score, na.rm = TRUE),
    n = n()
  )

data_mutate.title: Creating New Variables
data_mutate.description: Add new calculated variables to your dataset
data_mutate.task: Create a new variable 'grade' based on score (A: 90+, B: 80-89, C: 70-79, D: <70)
data_mutate.reference_solution:
students <- students |>
  mutate(
    grade = case_when(
      score >= 90 ~ 'A',
      score >= 80 ~ 'B',
      score >= 70 ~ 'C',
      TRUE ~ 'D'
    )
  )

barplot_categorical.title: Bar Chart for Categories
barplot_categorical.description: Visualize categorical data using bar charts
barplot_categorical.task: Create a bar chart showing the count of students by major
barplot_categorical.reference_solution:
major_counts <- table(students$major)
barplot(major_counts,
        main = 'Number of Students by Major',
        xlab = 'Major',
        ylab = 'Count',
        col = rainbow(length(major_counts)))

correlation_analysis.title: Correlation Analysis
correlation_analysis.task: Calculate correlation between study_hours and score variables
correlation_analysis.reference_solution:
cor(students$study_hours, students$score, use = 'complete.obs')
# Create scatter plot
plot(students$study_hours, students$score,
     main = 'Study Hours vs Score',
     xlab = 'Study Hours',
     ylab = 'Score',
     pch = 16,
     col = 'blue')

missing_data.title: Handling Missing Data
missing_data.description: Identify and handle missing values in your dataset
missing_data.task: Check for missing values and calculate statistics excluding them
missing_data.reference_solution:
# Check for missing values
sum(is.na(students$score))
# Remove missing values
students_clean <- students |>
  filter(!is.na(score))
# Or use na.rm in calculations
mean(students$score, na.rm = TRUE)
